snippet: Consumer advocates and others are urging New York State’s education commissioner not to sign an interstate agreement that they say would expose students to harm at the hands of for-profit colleges.
abstract: New York State education commissioner MaryEllen Elia is expected to sign State Authorization Reciprocity Agreement to create common system for states to regulate online higher education programs; nonprofit colleges and universities say agreement will help them compete in growing online market, while consumer advocates, legal aid organizations and unions say it could lead to exploitation of poor students by for-profit schools.
lead_paragraph: Consumer advocates and others are urging New York State’s education commissioner not to sign an interstate agreement that they say would expose students to harm at the hands of for-profit colleges.

headline.main: Critics Assail Potential New York Move on Regulating Online Colleges
headline.print_headline: Critics Assail Likely Move in Regulating Web Colleges
